intro: Lesquerella bernardina, commonly known as the Bernardina lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and related plants. The plant produces small, yellow flowers and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils. Lesquerella bernardina is of interest for its potential in biofuel and industrial applications due to its seed oil content.
